intro: Loeseneriella sogerensis, commonly known as the Soger's loeseneriella, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a waxy surface, adapted to the arid conditions of its habitat. It is typically found in rocky soils and requires well-drained conditions to thrive. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
